title: Core Competency Development Program for Understanding Digital Economics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic economic concepts and experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Participants access digital learning materials via personal devices (BYOD) and perform problem-solving activities centered on real-life cases. The curriculum combines digital economics theory with mathematical approaches

learning_goals: Explain core terminology used in digital economics (e.g., network effects, data value creation) with over 80% accuracy
Mathematically analyze the economic impact of online platform business models to achieve over 70% logical completeness in written responses
Replicate and interpret decision-making processes in digital environments (e.g., pricing algorithms) using simulation tools

resources: Interactive Data Visualization Tool (e.g., Tableau Public)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
